application.ref: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

titleStmt.title: Modeling Political Identity What Makes Independents Tick?

analytic.title: Modeling Political Identity What Makes Independents Tick?

biblStruct.note: We use data from the 2012 American National Election Studies (ANES), which surveyed Americans' political attitudes. We trained our models on approximately 3,000 observations.

div.p: 1. Independents' as a group cannot be easily distinguished from partisans.
2. Independents have a diversity of opinion and are captured by at least three "types."
3. Geographical location most distinguishes Independents from partisans. S t a t e I n t e r e s t i n P r e s . E l e c t i o n S o c i a l C l a s s W a r m t h t o P r e s .
